definition: Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3]
hole/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for cave dwellings
surname Kong
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
Confucius Institute, organization established internationally by the PRC, promoting Chinese language and culture
The School Sayings of Confucius, a supplement to the Analects/abbr. to 家語|家语[Jia1 yu3]
Confuciusornis sanctus (Jurassic fossil bird)

sentences.english: Confucius about drinking water and a single scoop sparse Louxiang refers only to this aspect.
sentences.chinese: 孔子談疏食飲水和單瓢陋巷指的都只是此一面。

sentences.english: His family was very poor, but he worked hard at his studies even in early childhood.
sentences.chinese: 孔子的家裏很窮，但是他從小就認真讀書，刻苦學習。

sentences.english: According to the story, Lao-tzu, the older of the two sages, thought very little of Confucius.
sentences.chinese: 據說，兩位聖人中那位年長的老於很瞧不起孔子。

sentences.english: Confucius' thought and theory of later generations produced profound influence.
sentences.chinese: 孔子地思惟及學說對後世發生啦極端深遠地影響。

sentences.english: Don't assume, however, that Confucius has entirely left the stage.
sentences.chinese: 不要以爲孔子已經完全退出了歷史舞臺。

sentences.english: He would not sleep like a corpse, nor stt like a guest.
sentences.chinese: 孔子睡覺不像死屍那樣僵直，家居不像做客那樣端坐。

sentences.english: I am not like Confucius who would teach any level regardless. I am sorry.
sentences.chinese: 像是我理應像孔子一樣，有教無類，來者就教。

sentences.english: Confucius is considered divine in many countries.
sentences.chinese: 孔子在許多國家被尊爲神靈。

sentences.english: Confucius regarded the talent thought as the important part of his political system.
sentences.chinese: 人才思想是孔子政治思想體系的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: Confucius, Mencius in on the basis of "force" the role of development.
sentences.chinese: 孟子在孔子的基礎上對“武”的作用進行了發展。

sentences.english: In the works of Confucius, afterlife, ghost and deity were seldom mentioned.
sentences.chinese: 在孔子的著作中很少提及來世和鬼神。

sentences.english: Critics say “Confucius” belongs in the latter category.
sentences.chinese: 批評者們認爲《孔子》就屬於後一種。

sentences.english: Confucius was a well-known teacher in the Lu Kingdom 2000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 孔子是一位2000多年前魯國的知名的老師。

sentences.english: Last year the district was awarded a Confucious Institute to support the Chinese language programs.
sentences.chinese: 去年該地區設立孔子研究所，支持中國語言教學計劃。

sentences.english: Confucius as the founder of the Confucianism is inside and outside double in the culture method.
sentences.chinese: 作爲儒家創始人的孔子，在修養方法上是仁禮互重。

sentences.english: Secondly, making a further study of space-time condition of Confucius' Neutralization and Harmony.
sentences.chinese: 其次，進一步分析了孔子中和之美的時間與空間條件。

definition: Mencius (c. 372-c. 289 BC), Confucian philosopher second only to Confucius/book of the same name, one of the classics of Confucianism
the Sage Confucius
Yan Hui (521-481 BC), disciple of Confucius, also known as Yan Yuan 顏淵|颜渊[Yan2 Yuan1]
Confucius
Yan Yuan (521-481 BC), disciple of Confucius 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3], also known as 顏回|颜回[Yan2 Hui2]
Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
Zengzi (505-435 BC), student of Confucius, presumed editor or author of Confucian classic the Great Learning 大學|大学[Da4 xue2]
Zi Gong or Duanmu Ci 端木賜|端木赐[Duan1 mu4 Ci4] (520 BC-), disciple of Confucius
Xun Zi or Hsun Tzu (c. 310-237 BC), Confucian philosopher and author of On learning 勸學|劝学
Zi Lu (542-480 BC), disciple of Confucius 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3], also known as Ji Lu 季路[Ji4 Lu4]
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
Confucius' school (i.e. his direct disciples)
another name for Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3]
The Analects of Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
Confucius and Mencius
model teacher of every age (idiom)/eternal paragon/refers to Confucius (551-479 BC) 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
